intro: Hibbertia hibbertioides var. hibbertioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats, such as heathlands and woodlands. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with woody stems and hairy foliage. The flowers bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators like bees and birds.
